One other thing I should mention here, which is quite important in the context of this talk or the the almost all tools nowadays you standoff annotation so you have your base text somewhere and then a tool does the annotation, not on the base text, but it does it on a separate layer and you have just pointers into the base text.
This has become a standard way for tools to operate.
Why you can encode arbitrary relations via pointers.
It's very simple to implement.
And it's very cool friendly so you don't.
You don't kind of touch the base text right, you just point into it and do whatever you want to do with your tool.
